definition: golden seal/characters tattooed on a convict's face
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: Hand turned over the securities, eying their gold seals .
sentences.chinese: 韩德把那些证券翻过来，瞅着上面打的金印。

definition: official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
(archaic) wooden or metal token of authority/(fig.) decree/directive/(computing) token

tiger tally (a two-piece object made in the shape of a tiger, used in ancient China as proof of authority. One half of a tally could be issued to a military officer and this would be matched with the other half when verification was required.)
arrow banner of command (archaic used as symbol of military authority)/fig. instructions from one's superiors
to be bestowed, conferred, or granted by the emperor
signature (in grass-style writing)/symbol used in place of a signature (on a document, contract etc)
